content: The ancient city of Rome was built on how many hills?

Rome, the eternal city, was famously built on seven hills. These hills are Aventine, Caelian, Capitoline, Esquiline, Palatine, Quirinal, and Viminal. Each of these hills has its own significance in Roman history and culture. For instance, the Palatine Hill is believed to be the site where Romulus founded the city in 753 BC, while the Capitoline Hill was the religious and political center of the city, home to the Temple of Jupiter Optimus Maximus and the Capitoline Hill. Today, these hills are integral parts of modern Rome, each offering unique attractions and insights into the city's rich past.
